description.narrative:
1.To improve health status of the poor people in the working areas by reducing the incidence of morbidity and mortality by 5% each year among the target population.
2.To reduce births in the working areas through the provision of family planning service to 36,000 child bearing aged couples.(12000 x 3)
3.To reduce incidence of malnutrition among the children through health education to all mothers coming to the clinic.
4.To reduce maternal mortality through treatment for complications in pregnancy, during delivery and after delivery by providing antenatal and post-natal services to 7,200 vulnerable women. (2400 x 3)
5.To reduce incidence of general diseases among women and children through curative and preventive care for at least 10,800 general patients. (3600 x 3)
6.To increase awareness on health and social issues through health education, seminars, conduct trainings on teachers-parents meeting of SEP, CEPSE, Hear schools and group members of WES, RSBDP and Pisciculture among 81,000 beneficiaries (27000 x 3).
7.To increase awareness on HIV/AIDS among the general population.
8.To take appropriate measures on eradication of Polio from Bangladesh as per Government plan through participation in the immunization campaign of National Immunization Day.

The program provides both curative and preventive health care to the most vulnerable members of the society, especially to women and children under five years of age, in the project’s working areas including hard to reach slums through ante and post natal care, general and gynaecological treatment, family planning motivation, education and service delivery, under-five treatment, Expanded Program of Immunization (EPI) and AIDS awareness program identified itself with the Government plan to provide HEALTH FOR ALL to achieve Millennium Development Goal in the areas of ‘Reduce Child Mortality’, ‘Improve Maternal Health’, ‘Combat HIV/AIDS, Malaria and other diseases participating in all Government National Health Programs.
